text:
The surgery robot in urologic surgery room.
Few weeks ago I went to semiology stage in urology and after a small recap and a endoscopy on a patient we went to the surgery room.
We were six : three in each room. We went to the one with one of the two robots for surgery in Paris : it was the latest, at the top of the technology and was really recent : it has arrived just few months ago.
There was a lot of people : nurses, and students in medicine, doctors. The surgeon had his hands on two joystics and controlled 4 articulated arms which were in the patient's body in 4 different little holes. He has his head on a screen with sort of glasses like microscope or binocular microcope. The camera was really good, there was a strong light and we saw everything on a screen.
The 4 arms can have different accessories and the surgeon controlled only 3 out of 4 ; 4 is when there is two surgeons working together.
The second seat where the second surgeon usually seat was free so we went on it just to see as if we where surgeons.
 It was amazing. I was amazed ; when I went to the room I was sort of shocked : the 5 first minutes, I didn't realise that the robot was in the body and that we saw the body's interior ; it was sort of unrealistic and futurist.
Then we discussed with the surgeon and he said that all the positive points due to this robot were incredible :
Less invasive surgeries : only 4 little holes and not a big one
Possibility to look and zoom in the body
 (he said that some surgeons saw anatomic structures that they had never seen before !)
More and more precision (all the moves are very little, with the help of the robot).
One last point that shocked me was the ability and how easily the surgeon did that surgery : maybe it is his work but he was doing a prostatectomy andjust talked about his friend's food habits with other people in the room as if he was in a bar !
To conclude, that was amazing and I really loved that morning.
